instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: [SOLVED]Macbook pro <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Wont boot to OSX.
threads.message:
Hi louis and team, 

I have a client macbook pro logic board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B that wont boot to OSX. Ive tried install with USB, command + R etc.. Nothing works.. Ive even tried with SSD disk that work on other machines, and then use it for this one, and it doesnt register or find the ssd disk. 

Do you know what the problem can be or  where I can start my search?..

threads.title: [SOLVED]Macbook pro <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Wont boot to OSX.
threads.message: Its probably not detecting the storage drive, does it at least boot from USB? If so: Already tried a new drive cable? Because those ALWAYS die

threads.title: [SOLVED]Macbook pro <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Wont boot to OSX.
threads.message: Hi smiba, thank u for the quick reply and support.. Greatly appreciated. :) I did change the driver cable twice earlier this week, no change, still not booting..  However just now, the third time I did now and the computer is booting up fine to OSX. You might have send me some magic.. :) thank you so much.. Wish you a great christmas and chat soon again..

threads.title: [SOLVED]Macbook pro <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Wont boot to OSX.
threads.message:
[QUOTE="smiba, post: 29843"]Its probably not detecting the storage drive, does it at least boot from USB? If so: Already tried a new drive cable? Because those ALWAYS die[/QUOTE]

Hi smiba, thank u for the quick reply and support.. Greatly appreciated. :) I did change the driver cable twice earlier this week, no change, still not booting.. However just now, the third time I did now and the computer is booting up fine to OSX. You might have send me some magic.. :) thank you so much.. Wish you a great christmas and chat soon again..

threads.title: [SOLVED]Macbook pro <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Wont boot to OSX.
threads.message:
Have a great Christmas [USER="1276"]lagadatorumea[/USER] !

Make sure you're not putting too much stress on the cable because they break fairly easy, I've had enough "new" cables just not work right because at some point in time they were just slightly bent. Glad its resolved though!

threads.title: [SOLVED]Macbook pro <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Wont boot to OSX.
threads.message: thank you... two excellent advice today in row.  noted ;) happy new year
